snippet: Some grass-roots groups want a ban on hydrofracking in New York, but some established environmental organizations prefer stricter rules.
abstract: Controversy over hydraulic fracturing in New York State has pitted grass-roots groups that want to ban the practice against established environmental organizations that want strict rules for it; issue reflects tightrope being walked by New York Gov Andrew M Cuomo between economically potent industry and one of the most powerful environmental campaigns in state history.
lead_paragraph: Some grass-roots groups want a ban on hydrofracking in New York, but some established environmental organizations prefer stricter rules.

headline.seo: Gas Drilling Critics in New York Face a Divide Over Their Goal
headline.main: Drilling Critics Face a Divide Over the Goal of Their Fight
headline.print_headline: Drilling Critics Face a Divide Over the Goal Of Their Fight
